snippet: Mario Monti’s announcement that he would step down as prime minister, raised the the possibility that he might run as a candidate.
abstract: Memo From Italy; Mario Monti's surprise announcement that he will step down as prime minister ahead of schedule raises prospect of more political uncertainty and market turmoil for Italy; also raises possibility that Monti will run as political candidate--in contrast to his role as apolitical leader--following former Prime Min Silvio Berlusconi's statement that he will seek office again.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome, Stephen Castle from London and Jack Ewing from Frankfurt.

lead_paragraph: Mario Monti’s announcement that he would step down as prime minister, raised the the possibility that he might run as a candidate.

headline.seo: In Italy, Mario Monti Morphs From Technocrat to Politician
headline.main: Next Act in Italian Drama: Exit Monti the Technocrat, Enter Monti the Politician?
headline.print_headline: Next Act in Italian Drama: Exit Monti the Technocrat, Enter Monti the Politician?
